Package aips.search

Class Action

java.lang.Object
aips.search.Action
public abstract class Action
extends java.lang.Object
This abstract class models a generic action in a search problem. All domain-specific action classes must extend this class. This class has a cost attribute defined as every action has a cost. That means you DO NOT need to re-declare the attribute in your domain-specific action class.
Author:
Kit-ying Hui

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    double cost
    The cost of the action.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Action()
    The default constructor that gives a cost of 1.0 to an Action.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    abstract java.lang.String toString()

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • cost

      public double cost
      The cost of the action. This is default to 1.0 for problem, which is effectively counting the number of steps. Depending on your problem domain, you may need to assign a value to this attribute in your domain-specific action subclass. Never re-declare this attribute in your subclass as the search engine uses this attribute. If you declare another action attribute in your action subclass, you will confuse yourself as there will be 2 attributes with the same name.

  • Constructor Details

    • Action

      public Action()
      The default constructor that gives a cost of 1.0 to an Action.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public abstract java.lang.String toString()
      Converting the action into a printable string. In your action subclass, you should tailor it to return a String containing details of the action.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      A String representation of the action, which can be used for printing.
